column5: Does anyone know of a good inland walleye lake for a day trip out of Sault Ste Marie, Ont. [email protected] Thanks Rod
You can try Tilley lake just north of the Soo on mile 38 rd. or Bass lake east of the Soo.
Some good lakes this time of the year is ottertail and bass lakes which are north east of the soo. For size go to bass lake and numbers go to otter tail or even caribou lake.Jason DoyonTeam Starcraft
anyone know of some good clean camps N of Sault Ste. Marie that are on good lakes. We have been going up through Int Falls and the drive is getting too long for some of the group.
when do you go up and how far are you willing to drive?
We often go up in late August and would be willing to drive anothere couple of hours from S> Ste. Marie
